metadata.title: CVE-2019-5747 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: An issue was discovered in BusyBox through 1.30.0. An out of bounds read in udhcp components (consumed by the DHCP server, client, and/or relay) might allow a remote attacker to leak sensitive information from the stack by sending a crafted DHCP message. This is related to assurance of a 4-byte length when decoding DHCP_SUBNET. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2018-20679.

criterions.comment: busybox package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1.27.2-2ubuntu5').
